posts.title: Sweetie [+extras]
posts.excerpt: Synopsis: Explores sisters, in their twenties, their parents, and family dysfunctions. posts.title: Luna Papa
posts.excerpt: Synopsis “Mix some Monty Python with the violent black humour of Yugoslavian director Emir Kusturica, add a little South American magic realism, and you might have some idea of what goes on in the thoroughly strange and enjoyable Luna Papa, a movie set in the contemporary world of Central Asia. posts.title: The Piano
posts.excerpt: Synopsis: A mute woman along with her young daughter, and her prized piano, are sent to 1850s New Zealand for an arranged marriage to a wealthy landowner, and she’s soon lusted after by a local worker on the plantation. posts.title: Pat Garrett and Billy the Kid
posts.excerpt: It’s 1881 in New Mexico, and the times they are a’changing. Pat Garrett, erstwhile travelling companion of the outlaw Billy the Kid has become a sheriff, tasked by cattle interests with ridding the territory of Billy. posts.title: The Lost Weekend

posts.title: The Search
posts.excerpt: A woman who works for a non-governmental organization (NGO) forms a special relationship with a young boy in war-torn Chechnya. Cannes Film Festival 2014 Nominated Palme d’Or

posts.title: Syskonbädd 1782

posts.title: Miners Shot Down
posts.excerpt: Renowned director Rehad Desai returned to the events of August 2012, when the Marikana mine in South Africa experienced the worst episode of bloodshed since the end of apartheid. For seven days, thousands of miners protested for a living wage. The non-violent demonstration was brought down through an intervention by state police forces, in which …
